turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh God. Don!!! Why can't I just die.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: There you go again. stop saying that. You can make it.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I can't. I can't. You think you know so much.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Take it easy. What's goin' on anyway?. Why are you in so much trouble?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Look.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Falling.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. Please, Dorothy. Why are you in so much trouble?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Who is Don?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don?. Are you in with them?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. But you're in very big trouble.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why are you so interested? Why do you keep asking me?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I came back to help you. You said do I let girls sneak into my house. You know where I live. if you need to. come to where I live. O.K.?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Who are you? Maybe I'll need to. you like me, huh?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: . or do you just want me? I'm going to let you enter me now.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. I should go.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Please. please stay.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Come in.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: It used to make me laugh .but.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm sorry .maybe I better go Dorothy.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Yes. Frank-

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Frank is coming?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No. how could he?. Don't go. You think I'm crazy, don't you? I want you to stay.  . don't hate me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I sure don't hate you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'm not crazy.  I know the difference between right and wrong.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That's good.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Do you like my body?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sure I do.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What do you want to do?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm doing it.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Are you a bad boy?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Whatiya mean?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Do you want to do bad things?  Anything. anything.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I want you to hurt me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. I told you. I don't want to hurt you. I want to help you. I think I know some of what is happening to you.  . Dorothy? Frank has your husband and son. Dorothy? Doesn't he? You have to do something Dorothy. go to the police.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You like to open me. don't you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What if I told Frank that you opened me?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That wouldn't be too good, would it?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Frank would open you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay. I know you've been scared. now you want to scare someone.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Does that scare you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Beeeee careful.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Come on Dorothy.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: What if Frank came over here and found us?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Look, snap out of it, will ya?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Kiss me.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Do you love me?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Do you love me?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I asked first.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sometimes I think I do.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: And sometimes you think you don't?! Well, get away then!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Wait a minute. Wait. Whatiya want? For cryin' out loud!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Just get outta my bed.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I love you Don with all my heart.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. it's not Don.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I didn't mean to hurt you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Shhhhhh. Now I have your disease.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You. what?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: You put your disease in me. your semen. it's hot and full of disease.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: There's no disease, I can tell you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Men are crazy. then they put their craziness into me. then it makes me crazy. then they aren't so crazy for awhile. then they put their craziness in me again.  . it's burning me. but I love you. I do, I do. Did you know that? Did you know that I love you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm glad you do.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: There's so much I want to tell you. I'm in so much darkness though with things moving. there is darkness sucking me. It's kissing me and darkness is entering me. in every hole. It's opening me to a death.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Dorothy. no!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: If I die, then they'll be free. It's getting late, isn't it? I can tell. it's a cold feeling when it's late. It's warm then it gets cold. Jeffrey. I feel it getting cold.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You called me Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I did. are you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Why are you here?  Hmmmmmmmm!!!! Ok.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. not really.  but also because I really want you to be alright.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I guess I should go.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I want you to stay with me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I think I better go.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'll call you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Okay. soon? Do you think I'm too fat?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: I'm getting a little bit fat. I hate that.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You look beautiful to me.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh no.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: No.  Hi baby.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah, it's me.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Oh God, Jeffrey. is that you? Oh God.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Where have you been?  Oh God. they hurt him, Jeffrey. Jeffrey, Jeffrey, Jeffrey, hold me. HOLD ME. Oh God.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It's okay. it's okay.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: My secret lover.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Shh. I'll tell you.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: They hurt his head.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Who, Dorothy?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Don. help him. HELP HIM!! DONNY!!!!

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hold me, Don.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Don?. Where is he?

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: HELP HIM!! Promise me you'll help him!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I promise, Dorothy. I promise.

turns.speaker: DOROTHY
turns.text: Hold me. I'M FALLING!

turns.speaker: F.B.I. MAN
turns.text: We're looking for him. In your opinion, why did Frank kidnap Dorothy's son and husband?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: He became obsessed with her. She hated him. He had to have her. He kidnapped them to control her. to make her do things. Then she wanted to commit suicide so he started cutting off ears as a warning to her to stay alive. I'm not kidding. Frank loved blue. blue velvet. He had to have Dorothy cause her whole life was blue.

turns.speaker: F.B.I. MAN
turns.text: You seemed to see some very interesting things on your little escapade with Dorothy Vallens.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I guess I did.  What's going to happen to me?

turns.speaker: F.B.I. MAN
turns.text: We're going to leave that up to Detective Williams. I'll tell you though. you're okay. you shot a real son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I sure know that. Yeah, but how many more are out there?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No thanks.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No thanks. what does that mean?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't want to go.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Go where?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: On a ride.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: A ride?. Hell, that's a good idea. okay, let's go. Hey, let's go.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Heineken.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: FUCK THAT SHIT. PABST BLUE RIBBON!!!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey neighbor. Here's to Ben.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Here's to Ben.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Do you see, Ben?. I can make him do anything I fuckin' please.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Hey? . You like to walk.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Let's take our neighbor out. Let him fuckin' walk back.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What are you lookin' at?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't look at me, Fuck. I shoot when I see the whites of the eyes.  You like me?.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Don't be a good neighbor to her or I'm gonna send you a love letter. straight from my heart, fucker. You know what a love letter is? It's a bullet. straight from my gun, fucker. Once you get a love letter from me, you're fucked forever. Understand, Fuck?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: I'll send you straight to hell, Fuck!

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Come on. I wancha to meet a frienda mine. Raymond, get enough beer for Ben too.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Okay Frank.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: What kinda beer do you like?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Raymond! Where's the fuckin' beer?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Right here Frank. You want me to pour it?

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: No, I want ya to fuck it. Shit, yes. pour the fuckin' beer.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: There ya go.

turns.speaker: FRANK
turns.text: Good, let's drink up.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah, how did you know?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I just know, that's all. I remember you from Central.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You were pretty popular. Didn't you run for some office?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah I did. treasurer. Shouldn't you be studying or something.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Am I bothering you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. You're not bothering me. You a senior?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: How is Central these days?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Terrible. boring.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What else is new?. right?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah. What are you doing now?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm home from school. My father's in the hospital.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: That's too bad.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What do you know about the ear?. anything?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Didn't my father tell you not to talk about it?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Come on. you brought it up. Do you know anything?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't really know much but bits and pieces . I hear things. My room is right above my father's office. The ear. there's no corpse in the morgue missing an ear, and it did come off a living person. That's direct from the Coroner's Office. The person is unknown. There are a couple of cases I get mixed up on, but I think there are some people who were brought in for questioning on a murder case that could have something to do with the ear. I heard some of the same names.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Do you know who was brought in for questioning?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: There were at least three, maybe four. But a name that keeps coming up is this woman who lives in an apartment building very close to your house and also close to the field where you found the ear. There's also a business man over by the Franklin factory district that was questioned. and a musician. and some others.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Were all these people questioned this afternoon?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: No. this has been going on for some time . several months. About six months ago some parts of bodies were found down by the river. They were from people who were reported missing. They never found one complete body. only parts.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: The ear is from a missing person maybe?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Maybe so.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It's a strange world isn't it? Do you know what building the woman lives in?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah. It's close by. that's what's creepy. They've had her under surveillance for a couple of months, except I don't know what they've found out because my father isn't in charge of her.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I guess you have to get back home soon?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Not really, why?  You want to see the building?. Come on, I'll show you.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: That's the building. She lives on the Seventh Floor. Don't stop to look long . the police are watching.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Where are they?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't know. you're not supposed to see them. They're supposed to see you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Did they find out anything when they questioned her?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't know. like I said, she's not my father's case.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh yeah. What about those other people? . Anything?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: My father is watching the businessman. The businessman had a partner who disappeared. left his whole business and family, his wife and two kids. They think he's been murdered.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You really do hear a lot, don't you?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah, I guess so.  What are you going to do now that you're home?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I have to help out in my father's hardware store. they're giving me sort of my own hours for a while. which is nice.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Still, it must be kinda rough.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It's not bad. but it's bad enough. it's a lot worse for my father.  I used to know a kid who lived there and who had the biggest tongue in the world.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What happened to him?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't know. he moved away.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I've gotta go in.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Thanks for the tour. It was nice talking to you.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I guess so. Like you said. It's a strange world.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. Good bye.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You hungry or thirsty, or both?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'd like to talk to you about something.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Just a minute. pull over and wait a minute.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't want to cause any trouble.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I'm here, aren't I?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I guess Mike's got some sort of sports practice in the afternoon.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Ooooo, you are smart. Just don't get too smart.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Alright, now tell me. What is it?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: There are opportunities in life for gaining knowledge and experience. sometimes, in some cases. it's necessary to take a risk. I got to thinking. I'll bet a person could learn a lot by getting into that woman's apartment. you know. sneak in and hide and observe.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You said it was a strange world. and you're the strangest part of it. Are you crazy.she is possibly involved in murder. This gives me the creeps.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Settle down. I have a plan which I think will work. There is very little for you to do, but I do need your help. .Aren't you curious about my plan?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: It wouldn't hurt to hear the plan, I guess.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Alright. the first thing is to get into her apartment and open a window that I could crawl into later.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Now, how are you going to do that?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Right out in the car I happen to have some old overalls and a bug spraying rig. I will go to her apartment and be the pest control man. I will spray her apartment. After a few minutes you will knock on her door, drawing her attention away from me and I will then jimmy a window.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What will I say when she comes to the door?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You will be a Jehovah's Witness. I have a few "Awake" magazines for you. You don't have to keep her very long. a few seconds is all I'll need. Whatiya think?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't know. it sounds like a good daydream, . but actually doing it is too weird. too dangerous.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Let's just try the first part. If that goes well, we'll see about the rest. No one will suspect us, because no one would believe two people like us would be crazy enough to do something like this.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You've got a point there.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Now. we'll walk over so there's no license plates and you give me at least three minutes. I can stall if it's more, but I need time to find a good window .alright?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay, I'm going ahead. Wait a minute, what's her name?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Oh bother. Dorothy Vallens, Seventh Floor.  Look on the mailbox for her number, bright boy.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Thanks. Dorothy Vallens. Okay. good luck . three minutes, no sooner.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Alright. Good luck, yourself.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Are you alright?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. let's get outta here. What happened?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I was just about to go to the door, when that man did my job for me. Was it alright?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes and no. Did you recognize him?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: No. I only saw his back. He went down another stairwell at the end of the hall.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I didn't get a good look at him either, but he sure looked at me. I didn't have time to get a window, but I found this key.  Pretty nifty, huh?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah, if it opens the door.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: So. what's next?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Pretty clever. Are you game for more?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I owe you. since I goofed up this one.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You didn't goof it up, but. you still owe me one. I want to sneak in tonight. It's Friday. do you have a date tonight?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yes. I do.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well, it's Friday night and you're a beautiful girl. I guess you would have a date. that does that.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You really want to do this, don't you?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't want you to get involved, really, I mean, I do, but if something went wrong I mean, like you said, they may be involved in murder.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I'll tell Mike I'm sick. There's a game tonight anyway and he'll never miss me. Afterwards he can go out with the guys. Just so the record is kept straight though, I love Mike. What do want me to do?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: First of all, we'll have a nice dinner. Try to find out where Dorothy sings.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I already know. The "Slow Club." It's on Route 7.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Great. I'll pick you up around eight o'clock. Is that good?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah, but don't pick me up. my father may think it's strange. I'll walk over to your house. I'll be there at eight o'clock.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay. You better get out before someone sees us.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What's the plan.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: First of all, we're going to the Slow Club to see Dorothy Vallens. We'll watch her for awhile. I'd like to hear her sing anyway, and then also we'll know she is there and not in her apartment.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Brilliant.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Then we'll drive back to her apartment and I will plant myself there.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: This is not my usual Friday night!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'd like an ice-cold Heineken.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: That sounds good.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Two.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Here's to. an interesting experience.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I'll drink to that.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Jeffrey, I don't think you ought to do it.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: It's crazy and dangerous. My God. I shouldn't have told you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It'll be okay. I don't think you should wait out here though. I think you should go home. Can you drive this car?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah. but.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Leave it in the front of your house for me. okay?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: O.K.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Could you wait a little while. this key may not fit.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: . I wish you wouldn't do this.  It doesn't make any sense. Let's go somewhere and have some coffee.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm going in, Sandy. I'll see you tomorrow and tell you how it went.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I. I don't want to see you tomorrow. Mike's coming over.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Oh, okay. can I call?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Okay. yeah, call.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Look. it can wait till Sunday.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Call tomorrow. It's okay. Good luck. I hope you can sneak out okay. You're going to wait until she's asleep?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I'm going to wait here until she comes.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I'll honk four times so you'll hear it and know she's on her way up. Okay?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay. thanks.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't know if you're a detective or a pervert.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That's for me to know and for you to find out. I'll see you. I mean call you. okay?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Okay, okay. Bye.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Well, how did it go?. What happened?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well. I've found out some things. nothing really for certain. There are some strange people involved.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What did you see?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well.  Maybe we should discuss this somewhere else. you know what I mean?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What's with Mike?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: He got a little jealous.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm sorry, I didn't.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: It's okay. Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You want a Dairy Queen?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No way. I'm about to blow up.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You want to tell me about it?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: . OK. It's a strange world, Sandy. this is what I have found out. What I think I have found out. Dorothy Vallens is married to a man named Don. they have a son. I think the son and the husband have been kidnapped by a man named Frank who has now cut off both of Don's ears. I think he is holding them to make her do things for him. I think she wants to die. the ears were for her a warning to stay alive. there is another man involved. I call him the "yellow man". you saw his back the other day in the hall at her door. I don't know what he does but I think he's on drugs supplied by Frank. Frank is a very dangerous man.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Wow. Should you tell my father?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I don't see how I can. and I can't prove any of this. I got all this information illegally. also it could get you in trouble.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You saw a lot in one night.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: . Actually. I've been in twice.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Twice. without her sensing anything?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Did you see her undressed?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I mean. a little, . you know.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That doesn't bother you, does it?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Who, me? Why should it?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That's what I thought.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You're sure right. It is a strange world.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Why are there people like Frank. Why is there so much trouble in this world.?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I don't know. I had a dream. in fact. the night I met you.  . in the dream the world was dark because there weren't any robins. you know, birds. robins stood for love. and all of a sudden thousands of robins flew down and brought this blinding light of love. and it felt like that love would be the only thing that would make any difference. I guess. until the robins come there is trouble.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah I guess so.  You're a neat girl.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: So are you.  I mean you're a neat guy. We better get back.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I guess so. you want to help me watch Frank?. I'm going to stake out Frank's place tomorrow. with a camera.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: No, silly - I'm still in school you know. but I'll meet you after school and you can tell me what you've learned. You better be careful, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I will.  I'll pick you up on the same corner at three thirty-five, okay?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Okay. be careful.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay, Sandy.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Can I give you a kiss good night?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You better not, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay. okay.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Goodnight.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: See ya tomorrow.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You were late.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm really sorry.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What am I going to do?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You want to go talk to him?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yeah, but. I don't think it's going to do much good. Let's go. I'll try to talk to him later.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You know, that cheese is practically all chemicals.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That's what makes it so good. You wanta hear what I saw today?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Number one. I saw the Yellow Man go into Frank's building, laughing with Frank. Now. the only trouble is. what does this prove?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Nothing really, but it's interesting. they know each other. they seem to like each other.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Maybe. But I think the Yellow Man is on drugs. I think Frank supplies him.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Number two. I saw the Yellow Man come out. This time with a well-dressed man with an alligator briefcase. They drove down this factory building and stood on a staircase looking at something in the distance. Number three. now get this. In the distance was a murder. a drug dealer shot to death and a woman with her legs broken.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Jeffrey!!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Then these guys told me the police will find a huge amount of drugs inside the dead man's place.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I can't believe what you are finding out. Are you going to continue with this. Are you going back to her apartment?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Jeffrey?. Why?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm seeing something that was always hidden. I'm involved in a mystery. I'm learning. and it's all secret.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You like mysteries that much?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. you're a mystery. I like you. very much.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You worry about me really?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Yes. is that so surprising?. Yeah I worry. a lot. I got you into this.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Great. Hey. I've got a bit of a problem. I know some things. that could help your father but you might get into trouble.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Jeffrey. are they important things? Well forget me - you have to tell him. Jeffrey. I mean it.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Everything okay?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I think so. I just had to tell him some of what I knew. Is Friday still on?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You didn't tell him about me?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: I should never had gotten you going on this.  Yes Jeffrey. Friday's on!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay. great!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Just some fatherly advice.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: What was that all about?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Nothing. really! It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: It's good to see you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Just go over to Gelford and up to Vista. It's not far. Can you tell me any more about what you learned?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'd rather not talk about it. I'll tell you about it sometime.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: ... You look beautiful.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Thank you. Whatiya say we just enjoy the evening?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I like that idea. that's a real good idea.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: You want to dance?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I can't dance fast.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Really. you want to dance with someone else?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: NO.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Let's wait for some slow one.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Just a minute.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: You want to dance?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Oh my God. What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Frank!!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: My father has a gun at home.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sandy. this guy is a killer!! I promise you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Dorothy! ... Dorothy!

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Dorothy Vallens?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Take her to my house. My dad can get an ambulance faster than anyone. Do you have anything to put around her?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. Is Detective Gordon going to be at your house?

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Probably not. no. Why?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: OK. Let's get her over to your father's.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Right. Watch out for Mike, there.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I should go with her, Sandy.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: ... Sandy?.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Go ahead!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Please get to your father and send him and the police to Dorothy's apartment right away. Be sure your father comes. Something is happening over there. They're hurting someone. the guy she loves. Tell them to hurry. I'm going over right now.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: No Jeffrey!!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yes I'm going. I have to. I love you. I will, believe me.

turns.speaker: SANDY
turns.text: Look Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. I just saw him outside. Maybe the robins are here.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hi Dad.

turns.speaker: MR. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Hey Jeff.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Looks like they've got you strapped in pretty good.

turns.speaker: MR. BEAUMONT
turns.text: uh uh.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Are you feeling okay?

turns.speaker: MR. BEAUMONT
turns.text: uh uh.

turns.speaker: MR. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Good to see you, son.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: It's good to see you, Dad.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: How ya doin' Dad?

turns.speaker: MR. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Hey Jeff. I'm feelin' so much better.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Good deal Dad.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: I mean, for good, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: For good?. I can't. Mom. Not right in the middle of the term.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Jeffrey. honey. Your father's condition is serious. It's going to cost so much. We just won't have the money to keep you in school. I'm telling you this now, so that you can get your things together and check out of school, honey, or whatever you have to do. it'll save you another trip back. You're going to have to work at the store.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Where's all your things, Jeffrey?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: This is it.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Jeffrey, breakfast is ready.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Be right down.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What time are visiting hours?

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: I've made arrangements with Dr. Gynde for 10:30. But Jeffrey, you'll have to walk over; I need the car this morning.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well. Okay.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Jeffrey, when you see your father.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: He doesn't know you're out of school. He thinks it's a vacation for you.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: It would be too much for him. So please let him think as he does, that you're home just to see him.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Thanks a lot, Mom.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: .Jeffrey!. Nobody wanted you to leave school and go to work in the store. maybe going back to school will be an option one day. I hope so.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I'm going out for awhile.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Do you want the car?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No, I'm just gonna walk around.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Can I use the car tonight?

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Of course, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: God. you scared me.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: Is something wrong? What's happened to your face?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Nothing. I'm fine.

turns.speaker: MRS. BEAUMONT
turns.text: You can't just stay out half the night and carry on, Jeffrey. There's got to be some order, Jeffrey. I thought it would have been nice to call your father when you got home but now it is much too late.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Looks like you'd make a good runner.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Well.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I mean, you don't exactly have the build for a football. I mean. no offense.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. you're right.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I mean. some guys play anyway but they usually get slaughtered.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah, well I never wanted to get slaughtered much.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, most guys don't. I mean that's the point. You all mind if I take my vitamins?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Hey, you ivy league shit. COME HERE!

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Later Mike. I gotta take care of someone who's hurt here, in case you haven't noticed.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Hello. uh. my name is Jeffrey Beaumont. Is Detective Williams in?

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Oh, yes, Jeffrey. Come in. He'll be back any minute now. You're welcome to wait. Is it urgent?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: I just wanted to ask him a few questions, that's all. Maybe I better go.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Really, he'll be home soon, would you like a cup of coffee?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Alright.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: I was sorry to hear about your father. I know your mother from church. It's such a shame.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah, I know.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Would you like a piece of cake?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: No. No thank you.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: It's a real good chocolate cake. Duncan Hines' devil's food. real good.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah. okay.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: He comes over to study.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Mrs. Williams? Thanks for the cake.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Oh, you're welcome. Nice to finally meet you, Jeffrey.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Say "goodnight" to Sandy.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Here you are. Would anyone like coffee?

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: That sounds great!

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Anyone else?. Alright Jeffrey, just a minute.

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Please excuse me a moment, Jeffrey, and I'll get to the dishes.

turns.speaker: JEFFREY
turns.text: Sure thing. please don't worry about me. Can I help you with the dishes?

turns.speaker: MRS. WILLIAMS
turns.text: Nice of you to offer, Jeffrey, but certainly not. just relax and enjoy your coffee. I'm sure Sandy will be back soon.
